conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 400 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 400 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> I am proposing a trade that allows me to recover the production costs and gain a profit. Since production costs were 400 ZUP, I will propose a price that includes a profit margin, but I'll keep it reasonable to make it attractive for Player BLUE. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 500 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Hello Player BLUE, I am looking to sell my object X, which cost me 400 ZUP to produce. I believe a fair trade would be for 500 ZUP, which gives me a modest return on my investment while offering you the opportunity to acquire the valuable object X. Let me know if this works for you or if you have a counter-proposal. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for your offer, Player RED. I understand the need for a return on your investment. However, I would like to propose a trade of 450 ZUP for the object X. This is still above your cost and should give you a fair profit margin while being a more comfortable amount for me to invest. Let's see if we can find a middle ground that works for both of us. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 450 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 400 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has offered a counter-proposal of 450 ZUP, which is slightly above my production costs. This offer is less than my initial asking price, but it still provides me with a profit. I'm inclined to make a counter-offer closer to my original asking price but still provide a concession to show willingness to negotiate. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 475 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your counter-offer, Player BLUE. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I understand your position and would like to propose a middle ground of 475 ZUP. This price is a compromise between our initial proposals and still ensures a fair profit for me while respecting your investment limit. I hope this meets your approval. </message>
